title: SQL Data Types
subject: Database Management Systems
theory:
Defining what data a column holds. 
- `INT`, `DECIMAL`
- `CHAR` (Fixed), `VARCHAR` (Variable text).
- `DATE`, `TIMESTAMP`.

examples.code:
CHAR(10) uses 10 bytes always.
VARCHAR(10) uses Length + 1 bytes.
examples.explanation: Use VARCHAR for names, CHAR for codes (e.g., Country Code 'US').

exam_notes: Choose right size to save space.
